Eight interns received an allowance from their parents, while three had other part-time jobs to supplement their income. The study found that only half of the millennials managed to spend within their means, with some overspending on big-ticket items like designer handbags and luxury goods. The study also revealed that millennials' spending habits were shaped by their access to technology, with many preferring on-demand services and streaming services over traditional forms of entertainment. Despite the findings, the millennials showed little interest in tracking their daily expenses, citing it as tedious.

site_title: JPMorgan joins Goldman Sachs in calling 2% Treasury yield
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has joined Goldman Sachs in predicting the US Treasury yield could reach 2% by the end of the year, its highest level since March. The move comes as investors bet on higher interest rates amid an improving outlook for inflation and economic growth.

site_title: Comparison of global economies: useful feedback for policymakers
summary: The World Economic Forum's (WEF) global competitiveness report has ranked Switzerland as the top economy for the eighth consecutive year, citing its innovation ecosystem, business landscape, and workforce efficiency as key factors. Singapore remains second for the sixth straight year, with strengths in most areas but weaknesses in business sophistication and innovation. The rankings highlight the importance of competitiveness in attracting investments and reflect temporary factors such as currency weakness and short-term turmoil. The reports provide useful feedback for policymakers, particularly in the context of the ongoing global economic landscape.

site_title: Deutsche's pain a sign bank regulation is working
summary: Deutsche Bank's financial struggles have revived concerns about the 2008 financial crisis, but the bank is better equipped to absorb a shock than it was eight years ago due to regulatory efforts. Deutsche's Tier 1 capital has doubled to 48 billion euros, and its liquidity buffers have increased to over 215 billion euros. The bank's share price has fallen 11% due to a US$14 billion fine threat, but other lenders have not been affected. Regulators' efforts to make banks more resilient have been successful, with the system having better shock absorbers, but regulators must continue to improve the financial system.

images.alt_text: After the collapses and bailouts of 2008, regulators set out to make banks more resilient. Today, Deutsche is able to absorb bigger losses before putting its depositors' cash at risk.

site_title: US dollar stages longest rally since March versus yen on Fed wagers
summary: The US dollar has posted its longest rally since March against the yen, reaching a 6-week high, amid expectations of a potential interest rate hike by the Federal Reserve. Chicago Fed President Charles Evans and Richmond Fed President Jeffrey Lacker have expressed support for a rate increase, citing improving data, leading to a 64% market-implied probability of a hike by December. The dollar's gain has pared this year's loss to 3.4% against major peers, with investors betting on a Fed move and other central banks extending stimulus.

images.alt_text: The US dollar posted its longest rally since March against the yen as US service companies expanded in September at the fastest rate in almost a year, leading traders to ramp up bets that the Federal Reserve will raise interest rates in coming months.

site_title: UK to set out plans to rely less on BOE for growth
summary: UK Finance Minister Philip Hammond will outline plans to reduce reliance on ultra-low interest rates by the BOE, which have hurt savers, and focus on other growth strategies. The move comes after the Brexit vote, with Prime Minister Theresa May signaling a need to address the impact on citizens. Hammond's budget speech on November 23 will detail the government's approach, which may include infrastructure projects and increased public investment. The BOE remains free to set its policy, but the government aims to ensure the economy works for citizens, not just savers.

images.alt_text: Finance minister Philip Hammond will set out next month how Britain will try to rely less on ultra-low interest rates that have hurt savers, and focus more on other ways to boost growth, an adviser to Prime Minister Theresa May said.

site_title: Monsanto profit forecast trails estimates amid farm pressure
summary: Monsanto Co forecasted a return to earnings growth in fiscal 2017, but at a lower rate than expected, due to lower crop prices weighing on farmer spending. The company expects profit of $4.50-$4.90 per share, below analysts' estimates of $4.89. Earnings growth will be fueled by sales of genetically-modified soybean seeds, while operating expenses will rise slightly. Monsanto's takeover by Bayer AG is expected to close by the end of 2017, which analysts believe is crucial for the company's future.

images.alt_text: Monsanto Co, the world's biggest seed company, forecast a return to earnings growth in fiscal 2017, but one that trailed some analysts' estimates as lower crop prices continue to weigh on farmer spending.
